entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Create PresenceDevice map to keep pointers in scope
entry.content:
Because |Core| takes in a `const PresenceDevice&`, it does not maintain

its own copy of PresenceDevice. Once the PresenceDevice goes out of

scope, referencing it in Core will cause a segfault. This change instead

uses a `PresenceDevice*` flat_map so Core won't be holding invalid

references when these functions go out of scope.



Test: this is an implementation detail, so no unit tests were added as

this is not part of the NC interface.



Fixed: b/315016880

Change-Id: I380ee6961468181f07b395d5a9a37f54fe1b4449

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5113403

Reviewed-by: Ryan Hansberry

Commit-Queue: Crisrael Lucero

Reviewed-by: Juliet Lévesque

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1254737}

entry.title: Make MergeFullSyncData() call through (almost) directly to ApplyIncrementalSyncChanges().
entry.content:
This removes a bunch of complexity with trying to merge

data from the Installed apps on the device, the Registry,

and Sync, and instead just takes data from Sync and applies

it directly to the Registry, like in the incremental case.



This means that WebAPKs installed before Sync was enabled

will not get backed up until they're launched again

post-Sync-enable.



This basically undoes all of https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pce17EEuIs0dIbw-L1RZVf2HA4H8-Lu8RqVxHGmdJds.



Note (in case it makes it easier to review) that the logic

from PrepareRegistryUpdateFromInstalledAndSyncApps() mostly

got split up between SyncDataContainsNewApps() and

PrepareRegistryUpdateFromSyncApps().



Bug: 1519196

Change-Id: I9be6878d89d89462495c01278403a58ad0149361

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5238455

entry.title: Test HeapProfilerIncludeZero for all reports
entry.content:
This makes HeapProfilerController test the HeapProfilerIncludeZero

feature whenever uploading a report, so that users can be sorted into

equally-sized groups.



With this change we can enable HeapProfilerIncludeZero for 50% of users

in M123 and 100% of users in M124. Then we can compare reports pre and

post M123 as follows:



* When comparing pre-M123 reports to M123, search for reports with

HeapProfilerIncludeZero disabled. (This will include all users before

the HeapProfilerIncludeZero feature landed in 123.0.6264.0.)

* When comparing M123 reports to post-M123, search for reports with

HeapProfilerIncludeZero enabled.



There will be a small anomaly on canary from 123.0.6264.0 to

123.0.6272.0, where HeapProfilerIncludeZero is enabled only for reports

that have 0 samples.



R=etienneb



Bug: 1327069

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Fix crash when reading on Spanish page.
entry.content:
The value returned by GetNextSentence can occasionally be less than

the current text length when looking at combined sentences when

a sentence is close to the maximum text length. When this happens,

we shouldn't attempt to add any text from the next node to our

current utterance.



This will likely be an obsolete change after crrev.com/c/5241650, but

since that is a larger change, I figured it was better to submit

a simple fix for the crash, since this is what by the code should

be doing anyways.



Bug: 1474951

entry.content:

entry.title: Make one less allocation in ConvertJavaStringToUtf(8|16)
entry.content:
Instead of calling JniEnv->GetStringChars to get a heap allocated

string, for small strings, we can allocate a buffer on the stack and

use GetStringRegion to just copy it. We end up with -1 allocation in the

fast path and it should be equivalent in performance (modulo the

allocation).



https://developer.android.com/training/articles/perf-jni#utf-8-and-utf-16-strings:~:text=stack%2Dallocated%20buffer



Bug: 1485798

Change-Id: Ic01a0173dbdd26a9513da93979d1ca1c9f007295

entry.title: Fix racy iterator use in Node::AddConnection
entry.content:
Before this fix an iterator to `connections_` which requires a lock

would be dereferenced outside an unlock operation because the `it` taken

from the map isn't understood as guarded by the same lock.



This takes a Ref before unlocking which'll keep the link

reference alive even if `connections_` is concurrently modified and the

entry removed (or replaced).



Bug: 1523704

entry.title: Refactor MenuControllerCocoaDelegateImpl.
entry.content:
In preparation of adding remote cocoa support to context menus,

this moves MenuControllerCocoaDelegateImpl to remote_cocoa code,

refactoring it to remove its views dependencies. Rather everything

this class used to get from views (fonts, colors and sizes) is stored

in a (mojom) struct, which is then passed to the delegate.



Using a mojom struct because in a follow up to actually add remote

cocoa support this will need to be passed from the browser process

to the app shim process.



To pass a font over mojom, this adds mac specific mojom serialization

for gfx::Font.



Also removes the now no longer used ColorProvider parameter from

MenuControllerCocoa.

entry.title: [RQ] Always filter out SRP urls from the MV sites
entry.content:
Currently max 1 SRP url can show up in the MV sites if the SRP segment

(e.g., http://google.com/search) makes it way into the segments table

(e.g., via bookmark click). This causes the latest search to always show

up in the MV sites if the accumulated visit count of that segment is

high enough. This is not a good experience and has been causing a lot of

confusion.



SRP URLs are filtered out from the MV sites when the Repeatable Queries

are enabled which is the case on Android only. This CL always filters

out those sites, whether or not Repeatable Queries are enabled.



Bug: 1317829

entry.content:

entry.title: Check full proxy chains in QUIC network transaction tests + clean-up
entry.content:
This CL updates several QUIC network transaction tests so that the

full proxy chain is checked instead of only checking the scheme of

the first proxy server. This will enable tests of multi-proxy chains

for IP Protection in the future. Decoupling the helper methods from

the type of proxy chain used also allows more tests to use them.



Also, this CL has some other no-op changes / clean-up:

- Adds a new SendRequestAndExpectSpdyResponseFromProxy method

- Refactors response data into const variables when it’s used in

a check later. A convention seems to be that "hello!" is used

for QUIC response data and "hello world" is used for HTTP

response data, so this has been preserved in the naming of the

variables.

- Updates naming of several other const variables

- Removes some unneeded code / comments



Bug: 1491092

entry.title: immersive fullscreen: fix content fullscreen child window handling
entry.content:
The overlay widget should not be displayed while in content fullscreen,

however is there is a child widget holding a reveal lock it could stick

around.



This CL moves child widgets from the overlay widget to the browser

widget while in content fullscreen. This clears child based reveal locks

from the overlay widget so that content fullscreen can take up the whole

screen.

classes

entry.title: Fix dangling pointer in ScrollJankUkmReporterTest
entry.content:
Problem:



Consider the following members of `ScrollJankUkmReporterTest`:

- `ukm_manager_`

- `test_ukm_recorder_`



During test setup:

1. ScrollJankUkmReporterTest creates a new `TestAutoSetUkmRecorder`.

2. Stores a pointer to the recorder as its base type `TestUkmRecorder`.

3. Transfers ownership of the recorder to a new `UkmManager`.

4. Stores these pointers `test_ukm_recorder_` (non-owning) and

`ukm_manager_` (owning) respectively.

5. During destruction of `ScrollJankUkmReporterTest`, `ukm_manager_` is

destroyed before `test_ukm_recorder_`.



Note that:

- ScrollJankUkmReporterTest declares these members in the order

`test_ukm_recorder_` then `ukm_manager_`, so their destructors are

called in the opposite order.

- `ukm_manager_` owns `test_ukm_recorder_`

- `ScrollJankUkmReporterTest` owns `ukm_manager_` but only holds a

pointer to `test_ukm_recorder_` for easy access.



Solution:



Swapping the declaration order to mitigate the dangling pointer issue.

Adding a few standard includes for presubmit [build/include_what_you_use].



Bug: 1485833

Change-Id: Ie98cf45c5d92b4ac7e83f30e176c0247bd39ed56

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5249953

Reviewed-by: Jonathan Ross

Reviewed-by: Yaroslav Shalivskyy

entry.content:
Previously chrome.alarms relied on base::OneShotTimer which tracks

relative time offsets and ignores device sleep time on some platforms

leading to alarms being fired late. This CL uses base::WallClockTimer

which adjusts internal timer on device wake up internally.

entry.title: [android] require WebContentsState buffer to be direct allocated
entry.content:
Currently, it's allowed to be either direct or indirect allocated, which

means that all the C++ code that deals with WebContentsState buffers has

to be prepared to be unable to access their bodies over JNI. This change

ensures that WebContentsState buffers are always direct allocated, even

when they are empty, which will allow the C++-side code to be both

simpler and more conservative about what inputs it accepts (ie: will

allow it to assert that it has actually been passed a ByteBuffer and not

something else).



Bug: 1523009

entry.title: Fix StreamCancel test flakiness
entry.content:
This all stems from how `getActiveRequest` behaves, previously a request

was considered as finished(count is decremented) the moment a callback

is executed but that was not what should have been implemented as was

changed in a later version [here](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4507293).



With this change, it became almost impossible to shut-down the engine

synchronously from within the callback as the value is decremented

after the callback, this was passing fine for onSucceeded and onFailed

because the active count is decremented immediately after calling those

callbacks and they are all executed on the same thread. While for

oncanceled, it was called from native asynchronously which left a bigger

window for race condition.



I have changed all three tests to wait for the active request count to

reach 0 before shutting down the engine.



Bug: 1523206

entry.title: Migrate third_party/blink/renderer/core/timing tests to blink_unittests_v2
entry.content:
Introducing blink_unittests_v2: new task runner for improved isolation, TaskEnvironment support,

and scoped Main Thread Isolate, addressing task leakage in current BlinkUnitTestSuite.

entry.title: Browser ignores intents on multi-display devices if main display is off
entry.content:
Commit c5b50f4c2d42e introduced a test that causes the browser to ignore

intents if the display is off. The test is implemented in

`chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/IntentHandler.java`

by calling the `isInteractive()` method of `PowerManageer`.



The approach works when there is only one display. However, it makes

the browser unusable in devices capable of turning on and off displays

independently of each other. An example are Samsung devices running

Samsung DeX. If the user is running the browser on the external display

and the main display is off, the browser will ignore all intents. This

prevents apps running on the external display, such as a mail client,

from opening webpages when the user clicks on a link.



The solution is to modify the `isScreenOn()` method to use

`Display#getState()` on the display returned by

`WindowManager#getDefaultDisplay()`.



This issue affects both Chromium and Chrome.



Bug: 1522543



display, open the browser on the external monitor, verify that tabs

can be opened by sending intents; see crbug.com/1522543 for more details.



Test: Start Samsung DeX on an external monitor, turn off the main

Change-Id: I8a48b546bbfc1f19d4738faf9acd9aeb0251567a

entry.title: Reland "[exo] Trigger output activation notifications from wayland::Server"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit d076b958a4ce4d3375f1b4b7cbbfe5ef9e4bb3ef



Updated to cleanup client-thread allocated proxy objects (see diff

against patchset 1).



Original change's description:

> [exo] Trigger output activation notifications from wayland::Server

>

> Currently each instance of WaylandDisplayHandler (client-specific

> output handle in exo) maintains its own aura shell observation

> so that it can notify clients when the output it corresponds to

> has been activated.

>

> This CL moves the observation into exo::wayland::Server code and

> delegates to the appropriate WaylandDisplayOutput global wrapper

> where appropriate.

>

> This CL concludes the centralization of display-related

> observations into the Server class. The result is cleaner and easier

> to understand code.

>

> Follow up CLs will extract display-output related logic out of

> Server and into an independent class responsible for handling

> wayland output objects in exo, making new output extensions easier

> to implement and support.

>

> Note: Since output activation is now propagated from Server, the

> ActiveDisplay unittest has been moved into the aura shell server

> tests. This allows correct widget activation => client output event

> testing post refactor.

>

> Bug: 1518335

> Change-Id: I3d75d22eb043ac78c094880cb86bbd64b8a9858b

entry.title: Updated UMA to detect missing first-paint signal at top frame
entry.content:
Behind a flag we already have a fix for the bug. The fix suppresses

input to the page until first paint signal arrives. Before we flip the

flag, we want to make sure that the topmost frame always receives the

signal, in order to rule out the possibility of input event starvation.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[PageLoad.Internal.SuppressedEventsCountBeforePaint]=Replaced by PageLoad.Internal.SuppressedEventsCountBeforePaint2

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[PageLoad.Internal.SuppressedEventsTimingBeforePaint]=Replaced by PageLoad.Internal.SuppressedEventsTimingBeforePaint2

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[PageLoad.Internal.SuppressedInteractionsCountBeforePaint]=Replaced by PageLoad.Internal.SuppressedInteractionsCountBeforePaint2

entry.title: cargo vet: Exemptions for remaining grandparented crates.
entry.content:
This CL adds `cargo vet` exemptions for the remaining grandparented

crates. Some grandparented crates had been properly audited

(e.g. https://crrev.com/c/5235422 and https://crrev.com/c/5240861)

but exempting the remaining crates seems like the best short-term

approach for unblocking crate rolls and incremental audits going

forward (e.g. see https://crrev.com/c/5178771).



This CL has been generated semi-automatically:



* `tools/crates/run_cargo_vet.py regenerate exemptions` have been run.

This modifies `config.toml`.

* Manually moved `config.toml` changes to `vet_config.toml.hbs`

* Re-run `tools/crates/run_gnrt.py vendor` (which among other things

regenerates `config.toml`



After this CL, `cargo vet` reports no more problems for Chromium:



```

$ tools/crates/run_cargo_vet.py

WARN Ignored 133 invalid audits when importing from 'google'

These audits may have been made with a more recent version of cargo-vet

Vetting Succeeded (52 fully audited, 1 partially audited, 26 exempted)

```



Warning: running the command above will make unnecessary and

undesirable changes to `config.toml` and `imports.lock` - see

https://crbug.com/1523332.



Bug: 1521111

Change-Id: I341694544e90965f4755a747d0fba024a699aa6e

entry.title: Fix check action for fuzztests on linux32.
entry.content:
We have an action which checks that the fuzztest = [...] gn line is

correct. This requires running the fuzzer binary, and sometimes we can't

do that - for example if a certain dependency DSO is missing in the CI

environment. In such cases we assume that the 'fuzztests' line is fine.

But in this circumstance we weren't writing to disk the 'checked.txt'

file which communicated to ninja that the action had been performed, and

thus ninja thought it needed to run this again on the next build.



Bug: 1499204

entry.title: [a11y] SetValue on a video's shadow tree <input type=range> now works
entry.content:
We had found a bug where kSetValue action when performed on the

element that is the timeline scrubber for a video

element was not working.



This was because this element internally was a AXMediaControl,

which unlike AXSlider does not have an implementation for

OnNativeSetValueAction and so we were defaulting to

AXNodeObject::OnNativeSetValueAction which led then to incorrect

behavior since we would expect this element to behave like a AXSlider

in this case.



This CL fixes this by adding an implementation for

OnNativeSetValueAction on AXMediaControl so that it behaves exactly

like AXSlider::OnNativeSetValueAction when appropriate.



Change-Id: Ia802f7ab8fe13e5a506b973f864a9dc6ff3f2fca

entry.title: Revert "Use LAYER_NOT_DRAWN if frame will not be used"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 147657f3688c28903582ed123294ec0ea52228cb.



Reason for revert: culprit CL for P0 bug https://crbug.com/1522740#c29



Original change's description:

> Use LAYER_NOT_DRAWN if frame will not be used

>

> 1) Lacros will use custom opacity control in exo instead of

> kWindowManagerManagesOpacityKey

> 2) It makes window opaque in Maximized and Fullscreen but not Snapped

> This was causing visual glitch.

> 3) If the frame is not used, the widget's layer will be NOT_DRAWN

> which should save memory.

> 3.1) I made small change to the frame protocol. Frame should be set

> before first commit in order for that subsequent frame change

> work. This is because layer's type can't be changed on the fly.

>

> Bug: 1445751

> Test: Updated existing tests to cover new behavior.

>

entry.title: Implementing uncompressed chrome installer
entry.content:
- setup.exe supports --uncompressed-archive, which specifies the path to

an uncompressed chrome archive.

- mini_installer.exe now supports extracting an uncompressed chrome

archive and an uncompressed setup executable, and running setup.exe

with `--uncompressed-archive` in this case.

- create_installer_archive.py now supports generating a resource file

for mini_installer with an uncompressed archive and setup via

`--resource_file_path_uncompressed`.

- a new //chrome/installer/mini_installer:mini_installer_uncompressed

target is defined for non-debug builds when the

enable_uncompressed_archive GN arg is true. this is provided for

developers who wish to build a mini_installer with uncompressed

resources -- it is not used in production.



Bug: 1511438

entry.title: Reland "Consistency check between AXObjectCacheImpl and AXTreeSerializer tree"
entry.content:

Reason for revert: https://crbug.com/1423022



Original change's description:

> Consistency check between AXObjectCacheImpl and AXTreeSerializer tree

>

> This is the lite version of checking the entire tree structure, only checking that the number of nodes is the same. It's easier to do and a more performant check. This CL only adds the checks. Four precursor CLs were landed to clean up object leaks and tree inconsistencies so that these checks would pass: AXMenuList (CL:4289642), Slots (CL:4294848), Image maps (CL:4291697), Inline text boxes (CL:4289593).

> Follow up: a future check should be added to check for consistency between AXTreeSerializer and AXTree.

entry.title: Revert "[WebNN][CrOS]: Support explicit padding for Conv2d/Pool2d"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a9e860a0cb6b1c30fc399690b2abac6e016ef7f9.



Reason for revert: Crashes in All/MLGraphTestTfLite.Conv2dTest/ModelLoader_Async, see e.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-dbg/35491/overview



Original change's description:

> [WebNN][CrOS]: Support explicit padding for Conv2d/Pool2d

>

> The ResNet graph in WebNN-Samples [1] is differt from original TfLite

> model [2], it merged the Pad operator into WebNN Conv2d with explicit

> padding, but tflite schema only support SAME or VALID [3] mode, so this

> CL inserts a Pad operator before Conv2d to implement the explicit

> padding.

>

> [1] https://github.com/webmachinelearning/webnn-samples/tree/master/image_classification

> [2] https://storage.googleapis.com/download.tensorflow.org/models/tflite/resnet_v2_50_2018_03_27.zip

> [3] https://www.tensorflow.org/mlir/tfl_ops#attributes_11

entry.title: [infra] Traverse edges to compute compile targets for a bundle.
entry.content:
Currently the compile targets for a bundle are stored as a property on

the bundle in addition to adding edges to their nodes. This

unnecessarily duplicates information. Since the edges provide the

guarantee that the compile targets have been declared, this changes it

to get the compile targets by traversing the edges and removes the extra

property.

entry.content:
These are only for functions that need to return a reference, but have

no empty object to return. They are slower than just using the default

constructor directly, and serve no purpose in other use cases.

entry.title: [realbox] Add support for vertical secondary suggestions in Zarya.
entry.content:
Allows contextual and trending secondary suggestions to appear

vertically instead of horizontally like entity chips. Contextual and

trending searches are shown when there are less than 3 secondary entity

suggestions available. Also adds support for focus indicator in these

vertically rendered secondary suggestions.



Vertical Secondary Suggestions (hover & focus):

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7t4d5JyPe9Af6k7

Vertical Secondary Suggestions (cr23 hover & focus):

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/59DYkg6EQ37vv8D
